member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.RegisterXamTreeNode(Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTreeItem,System.Object,System.Windows.DataTemplate)
member.summary: Registers the with the . If the XamTreeItem is generated, and already registered, the item that was passed in will be ignored and the registered item will be used in its stead. Also, if the item isn't registered, but is generated and the defaultItemTemplate contains a XamTreeItem, that item will be registered in place of the passed in item.
member.param: The XamTreeItem that should be registered with the XamTree.
The object that is the data of the DataTeeItem.
A DataTemplate that should contain a XamTreeItem as its content, which will be used instead of the passed in item.
member.returns: Returns the XamTreeItem that was registered with the tree. This isn't necessarily the same XamTreeItem that was passed in.

member.summary: Gets or sets the that will be used as an icon when a is in the expanded state. This DataTemplate will be applied for each XamTreeItem in the unless the is set explicitly on the XamTreeItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.ItemContainerStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that will be applied to a . This Style will be applied for each XamTreeItem in the unless the Style property is set explicitly on the XamTreeItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.CheckBoxVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a will be visible on a . This visibility will be applied for each XamTreeItem in the unless the property is set explicitly on the XamTreeItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.CheckBoxMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets how CheckBoxes will be treated in the
Manual - Each CheckBox will be treated independently of all other CheckBoxes.
Auto - Each CheckBox will notify its parent and children of its current checked state, and update them appropriately.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.CheckBoxStyle
member.summary: Gets/Sets the style for the on all s in the Tree

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.IsCheckBoxThreeState
member.summary: Gets or sets if each CheckBox in the is ThreeState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.SelectionType
member.summary:
Gets or sets what type of selection is allowed for the end user.
Single - Only one can be selected at any given time.
Extended - Multiple XamTreeItems can be selected via the ctrl and shift keys.
None - Selection will be turned off for the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.XamTreeItems
member.summary: Gets a collection of s. If a XamTreeItem hasn't been generated for an object as of yet, it will be generated here. Note: the XamTreeItem returned might not be part of the VisualTree at this point.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.IsDraggable
member.summary: Determines whether a can be dragged via a Drag and Drop operation.. IsDroppable will be applied for each XamTreeItem in the unless the property is set explicitly on the XamTreeItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.DefaultItemsContainer
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTemplate that expects a as it's root content. The XamTreeItem will be used as the default container for all generated XamTreeItems. If the root content of the DataTemplate is not a XamTreeItem, the property will be ignored and an Empty XamTreeItem will be used instead. This DataTemplate will be used for each XamTreeitem in the unless the is set explicitly on the XamTreeItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTree.SelectedItems
member.summary: Gets a collection that contains all the items in the that are currently selected. This collection can also be used to select and unselect addtional items.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTreeItem.SetIsChecked(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Updates the _isChecked member, to match the actual IsChecked property This is neccessary, as the Tree might be null at the time its set, so we need to wait until its not so that we can fire the events and properly perform the Auto checkbox mode

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTreeItem.SetIsCheckedSilently(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: This is so that when we're in Auto mode, we can update the Checked state of the node, without triggering events. If the _isChecked is set before the IsChecked, then we won't hit the event firing code in the PropertyChanged

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTreeItem.WalkThroughChildrenAndEnsureCheckState
member.summary: Ensure that the IsChecked was actually property set while a tree was attached to it. Do this for all nodes...as we 're in Auto mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamTreeItem.UpdateAllRelativesCheckState
member.summary: The IsChecked property has been set directly for this node...as opposed to indirectly by being set silently. This means we should update all of our children, granchildren, parents, grand parents, etc...

member.summary: Update the checked state of a child and all it's children, this is done silently.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.CheckBoxMode
member.summary: Specifies how the CheckBox will be used on the XamTree.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.CheckBoxMode.Manual
member.summary: Each 's CheckBox is independent of every other XamTreeItem in the

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.CheckBoxMode.Auto
member.summary: In this mode all Leaf XamWebTreeitems are 2 state checkboxes, and all other DataTeeItems are tristate. The checked state of an item will cause its children to placed in the same state and its parent to be notified. If all of the children of the parent are in the same state, the parent will be in the same state, otherwise it will be in a third state.

member.summary: The Source item was dropped before the Target item.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.DropPosition.DropAfter
member.summary: The Source item was dropped after the Target item.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.DropPosition.DropOnto

member.summary: The drag operation is on a valid drop location and is a copy state.
